meanings.definition: The external side or surface of something.
meanings.sent1: I like to sit on the outsides of the bench.
meanings.sent2: The outsides of the house were painted a bright blue color.
meanings.sent3: The outsides of the cake were decorated with colorful sprinkles.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the outsides of a freshly bloomed flower.
meanings.sent5: The outsides of the book were worn from being read so many times.

meanings.definition: The part of a thing that is furthest from its center.
meanings.sent1: The outsides of the circle are the longest.
meanings.sent2: He preferred to walk on the outsides of the path.
meanings.sent3: The outsides of the pizza had extra cheese melting off.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed to the outsides of the room.
meanings.sent5: The outsides of the tree branches reached towards the sky.

meanings.definition: The external appearance or aspect of something.
meanings.sent1: The outsides of the car were shiny and clean.
meanings.sent2: She focused on improving the outsides of her house.
meanings.sent3: The outsides of the clouds looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: His kindness shone through the outsides of his rough exterior.
meanings.sent5: The outsides of the mountain were covered in a blanket of snow.
